channel.title: New To 508's
channel.description:
Ok well, I have been coding 317's for a decent bit now, and I am going to attempt to learn how to code on 508's. My only problem is, when I go to run the 508 server, I go into the cmd folder, and double click the run file, but when the box opens, it says "The system cannot find the path specified"
Can someone please explain to me what I am doing wrong?

item.title: New To 508's
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

It can’t find your JDK version. So, you need to open up ya run file, right click it and press “edit”

Next you will see a line like

"C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_13/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m server

It brings up the error message because of your
Java jdk1.6.0_13 (Or what ever is in your file)

It’s trying to read of another java version, what you don’t have. So next you need to locate your java version!!

So, go to

C:/Program Files/Java

And you will see your JDK version
For example, mines

jdk1.6.0_13

So, replace your java version with the one in your run file, so for EXAMPLE!!

If my java version was jdk1.6.0_13 (Which it is) And the one in my run.bat said jdk1.6.0_12

I would need to change it, so it would go from jdk1.6.0_12 to jdk1.6.0_13

I hope this helps!!

~Johno

Read full topic
